headline.main: Everton Forward Bolasie to Have Knee Surgery
headline.print_headline: Everton Forward Bolasie to Have Knee Surgery

docs.snippet: Everton forward Yannick Bolasie will have surgery to repair knee ligament damage sustained in the 1-1 draw at home to Manchester United in the Premier League on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Everton forward Yannick Bolasie will have surgery to repair knee ligament damage sustained in the 1-1 draw at home to Manchester United in the Premier League on Sunday.

headline.main: Buffett's Berkshire Could Get $29 Billion Trump Tax Boost: Analyst
headline.print_headline: Buffett's Berkshire Could Get $29 Billion Trump Tax Boost: Analyst

docs.snippet: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc could get a $29 billion boost to its book value if President-elect Donald Trump is able to slash the U.S. corporate tax rate to 15 percent from 35 percent, Barclays Capital wrote on Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc could get a $29 billion boost to its book value if President-elect Donald Trump is able to slash the U.S. corporate tax rate to 15 percent from 35 percent, Barclays Capital wrote on Monday.

headline.main: Cosby's Testimony Can Be Used Against Him at Criminal Trial: Judge
headline.print_headline: Cosby's Testimony Can Be Used Against Him at Criminal Trial: Judge

docs.snippet: Comedian Bill Cosby has lost a bid to keep Pennsylvania prosecutors from using his own words against him at his criminal sexual assault trial, currently scheduled to begin no later than June....
docs.lead_paragraph: Comedian Bill Cosby has lost a bid to keep Pennsylvania prosecutors from using his own words against him at his criminal sexual assault trial, currently scheduled to begin no later than June.

headline.main: ‘The Revenge of Analog’: See It. Feel It. Touch It. (Don’t Click)
headline.print_headline: See It, Feel It, Touch It. Don’t Click.

docs.snippet: David Sax asserts that analog isn’t going anywhere, but is, in fact, experiencing a bracing revival. And it’s not just a case of nostalgia....
docs.lead_paragraph: David Sax asserts that analog isn’t going anywhere, but is, in fact, experiencing a bracing revival. And it’s not just a case of nostalgia.

headline.main: Justices Wrestle With Role of Race in Redistricting
headline.print_headline: Justices Wrestle With How to Disentangle Race From Partisanship in Redistricting

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court is trying to solve a constitutional puzzle: how to disentangle race from partisanship when drawing legislative maps....
docs.abstract: Supreme Court hears arguments from two cases from Virginia and North Carolina about redistricting along racial lines; cases are forcing court to wrestle with how to disentangle roles of race and partisanship when black voters favor Democrats; distinction is important because court has said only racial gerrymandering is suspect.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court is trying to solve a constitutional puzzle: how to disentangle race from partisanship when drawing legislative maps.

headline.main: Tyson Starts $150 Million Venture Capital Fund, Eyes Meat Substitutes
headline.print_headline: Tyson Starts $150 Million Venture Capital Fund, Eyes Meat Substitutes

docs.snippet: Tyson Foods Inc has launched a $150 million venture capital fund that will target investments in companies commercializing meat substitutes, deepening the largest U.S. chicken producer's foray into alternative sources of protein....
docs.lead_paragraph: Tyson Foods Inc has launched a $150 million venture capital fund that will target investments in companies commercializing meat substitutes, deepening the largest U.S. chicken producer's foray into alternative sources of protein.

headline.main: Jill Stein Takes Long-Shot Recount Campaign to Trump Tower
headline.print_headline: Call Rises for Recounts Outside Trump’s Door

docs.snippet: Ms. Stein, the Green Party presidential nominee, appeared emboldened as a judge ordered a recount in Michigan and her lawyers made a new case in Pennsylvania....
docs.abstract: Green Party presidential nominee Jill Stein presses her case outside Trump Tower for recounts of presidential vote in closely contested states of Michigan, Pennsylvania and Wisconsin, citing concerns about reliability of voting machines; Pres-elect Donald J Trump and his team see recounts as delay tactic, and call Stein's money-raising efforts to continue recount 'scam.'

byline.contributor: Monica Davey and Julie Bosman contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Stein, the Green Party presidential nominee, appeared emboldened as a judge ordered a recount in Michigan and her lawyers made a new case in Pennsylvania.

headline.main: California Bill Would Require Reporting of 'Superbug' Infections, Deaths
headline.print_headline: California Bill Would Require Reporting of 'Superbug' Infections, Deaths

docs.snippet: A California state senator introduced a bill on Monday that would mandate reporting of antibiotic-resistant infections and deaths and require doctors to record the infections on death certificates when they are a cause of death....
docs.lead_paragraph: A California state senator introduced a bill on Monday that would mandate reporting of antibiotic-resistant infections and deaths and require doctors to record the infections on death certificates when they are a cause of death.

headline.main: Sculptor Helen Marten Wins Prestigious Turner Prize for Art
headline.print_headline: Sculptor Helen Marten Wins Prestigious Turner Prize for Art

docs.snippet: Helen Marten, who turns the detritus of everyday life into sculpture, has won the prestigious Turner Prize for art....

headline.main: Mistrial Declared in Walter Scott Case

docs.snippet: Judge Clifton B. Newman of South Carolina declared a mistrial on Monday after a jury deadlocked on whether the white former police officer Michael T. Slager committed murder in the April 2015 shooting death of the black motorist Walter L. Scott....
docs.lead_paragraph: Judge Clifton B. Newman of South Carolina declared a mistrial on Monday after a jury deadlocked on whether the white former police officer Michael T. Slager committed murder in the April 2015 shooting death of the black motorist Walter L. Scott.
